name: Hotel Emilia Castillo

reviews.text: Charming little hotel just steps from the zocolo, the market, bars, resturants and silver shops. Beautiful rooms with hand-carved furnishings and tiled bathrooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. The one drawback would have been the street noise. I had an exterior room and the noise from the street below was quite loud until about midnight. After that it was relatively quiet, though when I wanted an earlier sleep, I needed earplugs. If noise is a concern you may want to request an interior room. Another suggestion, when I arrived in Taxco at the bus station, I decided to walk the short distance to the hotel, figuring the exercise would do me some good after sitting all those hours. Though the hotel wasn't far, Taxco is built on a steep hill with narrow, winding, maze-like streets. As I dragged myself up the hill and through a narrow, crowded market, with a hockey bag that felt like it was becoming heavier with every step, I regretted not taking the taxi ride up. Do yourself a favor, don't be a tough-guy (or gal) like I was and hire a cab for the short distance. Believe me, you'll get plenty of exercise just sightseeing and shopping in this town!
reviews.title: Gem of a Hotel that's Close to the Action

reviews.text: This is a quaint hotel right by the central square. Rooms are small and basic, but very clean and decorated well.
reviews.title: Quaint Hotel/Great Location

likes.disliked: — a bit basic for the price

reviews.text: Not all rooms are outside rooms so if you want a window, you'll want to make sure you ask to get it.
reviews.title: Mexican Charm

reviews.text: There are less expensive hotels with the same level of service in town, so if budget is important you could shop around.
reviews.title: TAXCO CHARM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me start by saying that this isn't a Holiday Inn nor should you expect it to be. This is Mexico...the real Mexico, not a beach front resort so throw away everything you know about those places and start fresh!
reviews.title: Very Quaint and convenient

likes.disliked: — Noise from Street and Lobby (Most hotels near city center have same problem)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful. You're very close to the the center of town and also to shopping, restaurants, etc. The staff is friendly, the rooms are kept clean and the rooms are nice. Beware, the beds are not what we are accustomed to in the U.S. but not bad compared to some of the places I've been in Mexico. After reading other reviews I decided to book a courtyard room because my wife is a light sleeper. It wasn't much good as there was noise from people in the Lobby until past 1:00 a.m. - thankfully she was tired and slept fairly well. I don't think this is normal as we were there during the National Silver Festival and the town was busy and all the hotels were packed that weekend.
reviews.title: Very colonial looking hotel

likes.disliked: — Noise from cars could be heard in room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Emilia Castillo and would go back again. You can't beat the price! At the rate of exchange while we were down there the room cost less than $40 U.S. per night. Also, an FYI, the owner of the hotel is a very good jewelry designer and is very well respected in the community.
reviews.title: An Excellent Choice

reviews.text: There is a small cafe right next to the hotel called The Cafe Sasha. I recommend eating your breakfast there. The prices are very reasonable (about $4-$5 gets you a very good breakfast) and the owners are very friendly. The photo I posted showing the street view in front of the hotel is from the balcony of the cafe (you go up the stairs to get to this restaurant...it's worth the climb!).
reviews.title: Wonderful location, quaint hotel

likes.liked: — Location, quintness and architecture or the building, Cafe Sasha next door
likes.disliked: — Noise outside, bed was fairly hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very affordable, cozy and for the actual amount of time you will spend in your room this hotel is more than worth it. Bring your hiking shoes as everything in Taxco seems to be an uphill climb!!
reviews.title: Good location

likes.disliked: — plumbing needed a bit of upgrading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend and after reading reviews here, I selected to stay here. It was a great choice, one of the best locations in Taxco. Rooms are clean, bathrooms could be better, but they are very clean. Downstairs has a small dining room, which is decorated in a very nice traditional and contemporary way. Breakfast was excellent, for only 70 additional pesos, for two people, you can't beat that.
reviews.title: Great Location, clean, very friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this place, if you want to be in the heart of Taxco, not paying a lot of money
reviews.title: Very Accommodating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed for one night, and it was just what we were looking for. The rooms are OK-priced for what they are, at 550 pesos for a queen bed. The room was clean with hot water.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel in a great area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know if the staff speaks much or any English, but I wouldn't let that deter anyone who only speaks English. If you do speak Spanish, do get to know the staff because they are extremely friendly.
reviews.title: Good value well located small hotel

reviews.text: The location is GREAT, and the lobby is beautiful...perfect for an evening drink. There isn't a whole lot to offer for food other than the meal of the day or some coffee in the morning — they had cereal written on their menu, and when I asked for it, the owner walked across the street and bought fresh milk and cereal. We met another couple where the owners let them use the kitchen to chop up some fruit they had bought from outside.
reviews.title: Just one block from main plaza

description: Hotel Emilia Castillo is a quaint hotel in the heart of Taxco, Mx. known as "Silver City". The hotel is a short walk to safe parking and major sites in Taxco. As you enter the lobby you are surrounded by beautiful artistic creations. Emilia, The owner, is a second generation silversmith and jewelry designer and her unparalleled creativity abounds as you walk through the hotel. A helpful staff is always there to answer your needs. We feel that you will be more than comfortable and you will want to come back again. So come join us at Hotel Emilia Castillo.
